repository.corpname: University of Montana, Mansfield Library, Archives and Special Collections

did.abstract: This collection contains correspondence, financial, legal, organizational, and promotional records generated and collected by the Great Falls Breweries, Inc. and its subsidiary, the Montana Malting Company. Collection materials document procedures and finances within the company and professional relationships with product distributors, industry representatives, other regional breweries, suppliers, elected officials, and government regulators.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Great Falls Breweries Inc. was founded by Emil Sick in 1933 immediately after the repeal of Prohibition. It was begun with the purchase of the interests of the Montana Brewing Company and the American Brewing Company, two Great Falls firms dating from the 1890s that had been closed by Prohibition. Mr. Sick continued the operation until 1949 when he sold the property to local interests. It was again sold in 1966 to Blitz-Weinhard Company of Portland, Oregon, which continued operations until September, 1968 when severe economic conditions forced the closure of the Great Falls plant. At the time of its closing, the Great Falls operation was the last operating brewery in the four state area of Montana, Idaho, North Dakota, and Wyoming

scopecontent.p: This collection contains correspondence, financial, legal, organizational, and promotional records generated and collected by the Great Falls Breweries, Inc. and its subsidiary, the Montana Malting Company. Collection materials document procedures and finances within the company and professional relationships with product distributors, industry representatives, other regional breweries, suppliers, elected officials, and government regulators. These records provide insights into rural Montana brewing businesses in the years following repeal of Prohibition, through the Great Depression, and into the post World War II economic transformations across the American west. Collection materials particularly evidence the impacts on regional (bottle-oriented) breweries precipitated by 1960s canned beer packaging innovations.

arrangement.p: The collection is arranged in seven series:

accessrestrict.p: Researchers must use collection in accordance with the policies of Archives and Special Collections, the Maureen and Mike Mansfield Library, and the University of Montana--Missoula. Materials in box 18, folders 6 and 7, box 19, folder 1 are restricted access under Social Security Administration regulations.

userestrict.p: Researchers are responsible for using in accordance with 17 U.S.C. and any other applicable statutes. Copyright not transferred to the University of Montana.

prefercite.p: [Name of document or photograph number], Great Falls Breweries, Inc. Records, Archives and Special Collections, The University of Montana-Missoula.

custodhist.p: The Blitz-Weinhard Company purchased Great Falls Breweries, Inc. in 1966 and suspended Montana operations in 1968. The Blitz-Weinhard Company placed all Great Falls Breweries Inc. records in a storage unit until donation to the Archives.

acqinfo.p: Gift of Blitz-Weinhard Company, 1970. The remainder, two original stock ledger journals, 1938-1966, now in Series II, Box 40, and 3 copies of stockholder lists, two from 1966 and one from 1967, now in Box 37/12, were donated by Stoel Rives, Attorneys at Law, 2012.

processinfo.p: The specific actions of the original processors were not documented. During 2004 reprocessing, distinct series were applied to collection materials, items were reorganized for consistent identification and access, and the full collection was extensively re-described.

separatedmaterial.p: During 2004 reprocessing, 5 folders of general interest publications (all dated 1961) were transferred to the Mansfield Library's Special Collections.

controlaccess.p: This collection is indexed under the following headings in the online catalog. Researchers desiring materials about related topics, persons, or places should search the catalog using these headings.

scopecontent.p: This series contains incoming and outgoing correspondence related to Great Falls Breweries, Inc. business operations. These materials document procedures and finances within the company and professional relationships with product distributors, industry representatives, other regional breweries, suppliers, elected officials, and government regulators.

This series contains financial and legal records generated by Great Falls Breweries, Inc. Among these materials are accounts receivable, audits, inventories, invoices, payroll, stock registers, federal income and alcohol control documents, as well as daily, monthly and annual reports--including a nearly complete sequence of brewery monthly transaction statements from 1933 to 1966. These records document market conditions, supply sources, and management decisions spanning a period of dramatic economic transformation within the brewing industry and across the American west.

accessrestrict.p: Materials in box 18, folders 6 and 7, box 19, folder 1 are restricted access under Social Security Administration regulations.

scopecontent.p: This series contains organizational records generated by Great Falls Breweries, Inc. These records primarily document Board of Directors and shareholder lists and meeting materials. Also included are equipment designs, manuals, and instructions, a brewery floor plan developed during renovations in 1954, and office administration documents.
This series contains a short sequence of brewing industry publications and competitor advertising samples collected by Great Falls Breweries management.

did.unittitle: Uniform Classification of Accounts for the Brewing Industry

scopecontent.p: This series contains financial and organizational records generated by the Montana Malting Company, a wholly-owned division of Great Falls Breweries, Inc. These records document procedures implemented and challenges faced by the brewery to establish its own, large-scale malting operation intending to expand distribution following the repeal of the 18th Amendment to the U.S. Constitution and related Prohibition laws.
This series contains three photographs of Great Falls Breweries advertising images. Two images are bottle label designs and the third is a road sign demo.

did.unittitle: Great Falls Breweries, Inc., Bottle Label Design

scopecontent.p: This series consists of two corporate seal stamps, one each for Great Falls Breweries, Inc. and Montana Malting Company.
